title: zero-dimensional numpy arrays should raise exception on from_numpy
body_html: It seems that the way how slicing is handled in pytorch is a little bit inconsistent with numpy and with pytorch itself. For example, one can create a tensor with empty dimension like 0x3 matrix (in numpy and pytroch). However, when trying to get a slice that will lead to no dimension tensor "ValueError: result of slicing is an empty tensor" error occurs. Is there any reason for implementing it differently compare to numpy?
